intro: Secamone attenuata, commonly known as the slender secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals.
